title: Possible System to reform Permabanned Players and get them their accounts back
body: So i tweeted riot support asking if anything like this was in the works. There isnt and i feel there should be. There are many players who have had their main accounts permanently banned due to toxic behaviors, such as myself. Those with banned accounts have lost lots of money, playtime, and achievments with the loss of their accounts. I believe permanent bans with no chance of recovery to be harsh. I believe that riot should develope a system where those with permabanned accounts can get a special provisionary account that is monitored by riot and is on probationary status with restrictions set against toxicity and etc.. (Restrictions against what they were permabanned for). You should be able to use these accounts to play out over a certain period of time, say a year, and have them represent you reforming as a player and person for the better and proving you need an account permaban removed. It would make a lot of sense for those who lost their accounts to both have a chance to reform as a person or face consequences and to possibly acquire their accounts again. Does anyone else like this idea? If so lets have rioters see this. Please message me if youd like anymore ideas. Lets work towards reforming players and getting their accounts back.

replies.body:
So, we know of at least 2 separate unban experiments have been done by Riot. 

The first we were told was a complete failure basically. Like 5% of the people actually proved to reform once the accounts were given back.

The second, we never got an official response/report, but we have seen some people who claimed to have been unbanned punished again.

So why should we support a 3rd experiment?
3 experiments if you count the challenge to 30 (something more similar to what OP is suggesting) experiment they ran many years ago

> [{quoted}](name=zPOOPz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ZwFTJEHH,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-09-28T01:04:30.358+0000)
>
> 3 experiments if you count the challenge to 30 (something more similar to what OP is suggesting) experiment they ran many years ago

The level 20 challenge was one the 2 experiments.  I'm not aware of a third experiment.

The level to 20/30 challenge was back during Season 3,4, or 5 during the time of Rito Lyte where a few people are told to make a new account and level it up to 20 or 30 without incurring punishment.  If they can, they can have their perma-banned account back.

Sometimes during Season 5, 6, or 7 during the time of Rito Tantram, they allowed a group of perma-banned players to have their accounts back and set them to the 14-day banned status (that means any slight validly reported toxic game will return them to perma-ban).

Sometimes last year or this year, Rito Wookie ran another unban experiment like the one Tantram did.  That makes 3.

> 
> Sometimes last year or this year, Rito Wookie ran another unban experiment like the one Tantram did.  That makes 3.

Huh.  I would need to look back through the boards, since I only remember the Level 20 challenge and one other, maybe a couple years ago.

Enough with the "possible reform systems" already. You got permabanned and there is no way around it. Quit trying ask riot to implement dumb systems to unban toxic players who have been banned for obvious reasons. Riot gave you many warnings of what would happen if you continue the negative behavior and many players chose to ignore them and got permabanned for it. This is what happends when you don't listen, deal with it. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

>So i tweeted riot support asking if anything like this was in the works. There isnt and i feel there should be.

 The reason there isn't anything in development regarding permabanned players is because of the two previous [**unban experiments held on NA.**](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/9356yc/why_are_people_in_na_having_their_permabanned/e3bbx8j/)

(both times) A select group of players on NA were chosen to have their punishment status reduced from a permanent ban to a 14-day suspension. The first experiment resulted in a high failure rate (70-90%+) and the other never had it's results released (most players including myself assume it to be a failure for this reason.)

As of right now, Riot just doesn't have a reason to revert those correctly placed punishments.

>Does anyone else like this idea?

 It would be nice to have my old account back, but there has to be _**real**_ consequences when it comes to the rules.

Riot has no interest in pouring resources into helping permabanned players. Why should they, after what those players did? They want those players to quit the game entirely and never return, hence the permabans.
If this was true they would likely impose ip/id bans. They dont. They let them make new accounts.

Because IP bans don't work and ID bans require a lot of manual work and only really work with well known players, like streamers and pro players. They let them make new accounts because anything else just cannot be enforced.

> [{quoted}](name=Jíro,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ZwFTJEHH,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-09-28T21:46:19.933+0000)
>
> If this was true they would likely impose ip/id bans. They dont. They let them make new accounts.

Incorrect. IP bans are worthless, and ID bans are already given occasionally but infeasible for most players.

If you get permabanned, Riot wants you to leave.

you get multiple chances to reform every season

afaik, punishment progress gets reset every season. at least, it seems like it. i've gotten 2 chat-based 14-day bans back to back in 2 different seasons twice

between season 7 and season 8, and between season 8 and season 9
Uhh, not normally. Did you get those punishments early in each season? Did you play alot between the punishments?
It normally takes between three and six months of regular playing with good behavior to drop one punishment tier.

Lol at first I was amazed that someone actually cared about other permabanned player's accounts being restored to them. Then I got to the part where you have a permabanned account. Of course. Its always only people who have been permabanned and want their account back.
Well i mean i do care about others acclunts. I believe that everyone with permabanndd accounts hold the same views i do and want to reform.

> There isnt and i feel there should be.

No there shouldn't. Punishments have to be punishments or they're not effective. Every experiment done in this vein before has failed. Failed hard. For the few permabanned players who have actually reformed, their recourse is to start a new account.

Riot has stated multiple times that **they are not interested in finding more ways for pemabanned players to continue playing - they want them to stop playing.** They had chances. I don't want them back in my goddamn games.
I feel like probationary periods where one strike equals no more chances would work. It would encourage only those who truly want their accounts back to make the attempt.
Because it didn't work in the past and won't work now. If people didn't want their accounts banned, they shouldn't have been such incorrigible, unrepentant, Hell-bound motherfuckers.
